New Records: Vangelis Pavlidis' brace made history for Greece against England, marking Greece's first-ever win over England.
Key Match Events: Vangelis Pavlidis scored the first goal for Greece in the 49th minute.
Jude Bellingham equalized for England in the 87th minute.
Vangelis Pavlidis scored the winning goal for Greece in the fourth minute of stoppage time.
Greece had three goals ruled out for offside.
Levi Colwill made a brilliant goalline clearance to prevent a goal after a mistake by Jordan Pickford.
Pre-Game Insights: England Interim manager Lee Carsley was hopeful to return as U21s coach if not offered a permanent job with the men's team.
There was a minute's silence held before kickoff for Greece's former international George Baldock who died this week.
Lee Carsley fielded an ultra-attacking line-up including Cole Palmer, Jude Bellingham, and Phil Foden.
Post-Match Reflections: John Stones, captain in place of injured Harry Kane, expressed his disappointment with the result.
Lee Carsley received a sobering reality check after the defeat, which may have affected his chances of becoming a full-time manager.
Vangelis Pavlidis dedicated the match to George Baldock, emphasizing the emotional significance of the victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at Wembley Stadium with an attendance of 79,012.
England's first defeat under Lee Carsley left them second in the Nations League Group B2 with six points, while Greece topped the table with nine points.
